creator: benderamp@gmail.com
text:
Tomcat6 distribution tar.gz binary archives (for example apache-tomcat-6.0.18.tar.gz taken from here http://archive.apache.org/dist/tomcat/tomcat-6/v6.0.18/bin/) do not contain sh scripts inside - only bat-files and windows executables.

There is startup.bat, shutdown.bat etc, but there is no startup.sh, shutdown.sh there. I have checked at least versions 6.0.14, 6.0.16 and 6.0.18

zip versions do contain both bat and sh scripts. 

Since tar.gz seems to be related more to linux/unix rather than to windows, it seems to be natural to see sh-scripts inside tar.gz tomcat archive, and zip tomcat archive can contain only bats.

creator: markt@apache.org
text: I have been using the .tar.gz archive for 6.0.18 on linux without any problems. I have also just double checked the tar.gz for 6.0.18 from the archive and the .sh scripts are present.
